nodes.bodyText: nit, avoiding dependencies in documentation makes it easier to maintain. Specifically the "4 plugins", if we add a plugin to the list either that will be out of date or we'll need to update it. One could say instead "There are a few plugins to install..." which would make it more generic and less likely to become out of date.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,23 +1,27 @@
 ## *IntelliJ* Setup
 
-### Plugins:
-  - *Google Java Format*
-    - *settings > Other settings > google-java-format*
-    - Check 'enable'
+Setting up *IntelliJ* is pretty simple.  There are 4 plugins to install with the associated settings, and some settings to download and import.

nodes.bodyText: Suggestion: Giving a link to the checkstyle file might make this easier?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,23 +1,27 @@
 ## *IntelliJ* Setup
 
-### Plugins:
-  - *Google Java Format*
-    - *settings > Other settings > google-java-format*
-    - Check 'enable'
+Setting up *IntelliJ* is pretty simple.  There are 4 plugins to install with the associated settings, and some settings to download and import.  
+
+### Plugins: 
+  1. *Google Java Format*
+        1. *settings > Other settings > google-java-format*
+        2.  Check 'enable'
       ![Screenshot from 2019-08-08 17-35-52
       ](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12397753/62746114-07cc2b80-ba03-11e9-9ac0-0b1e6e1e8788.png)
-  - *checkstyle-IDEA* [plugin](https://github.com/jshiell/checkstyle-idea)
-    - after install finish configuration in: **Other Settings > Checkstyle**
-    - select checkstyle file:
-  - *Save Actions*
-    - configure in settings to add 'final' to local variables and class variables.
-  - *Lombok*
+  2. *checkstyle-IDEA* [plugin](https://github.com/jshiell/checkstyle-idea)
+        1. after install finish configuration in: **Other Settings > Checkstyle**
+        2. select checkstyle file:

nodes.bodyText: Ah, indeed it is an important step. There are two built-in checkstyle settings, you do need to explicitly select and import and the tripleA checkstyle. It's probably worth mentioning that the setting to 'scan test sources' should be selected as well so IDEA will run checkstyle on test files.

nodes.bodyText:
8.8 is slightly older, I think the latest is 8.30 something. Our conflict XML is a bit dated so only the older version works.
The checkstyle.xml file is checked in, you should be able to find it in the cloned code:
https://github.com/triplea-game/triplea/blob/master/config/checkstyle/checkstyle.xml

nodes.bodyText: Nit, most markdown you can use 1 for each item in the numbered list and the numbering will be done automatically. This lets you insert items in the middle of the list without having to renumber the whole thing.

nodes.bodyText: I saw it here and one of your other comments, what is nit?

nodes.bodyText:
"nit" is short for "nitpick". You will probably see that and 'side-comment' from reviewers. 'side-comment' means discussion about something that already existed and is not for the current PR.
Nits can be frustrating if a reivew is all nitpicks and is not looking at the larger picture. A comment prefaced as a nit is an acknowledgement that it's a pretty low-level type of thing being commented on. So while ideally we would not need to nitpick, it is code, and the details do add up and can be very important.
